From Wiktionary, the free dictionary

Catalan

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Borrowed from Latin administrāre.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): (Central, Balearic) [əd.mi.nisˈtɾa]
  • IPA(key): (Valencia) [ad.mi.nisˈtɾaɾ]
  • Audio (Barcelona):(file)
  • Homophone: administrà
  • Rhymes: -a(ɾ)

Verb

[edit]

administrar (first-person singular present administro, first-person singular preterite administrí, past participle administrat)

  1. (transitive) to administer (cause to take)
  2. (transitive) to administer, to manage (manage or supervise the conduct of)

Conjugation

[edit]
    Conjugation of administrar (first conjugation)
infinitive administrar
gerund administrant
past participle masculine feminine
singular administrat administrada
plural administrats administrades
person singular plural
first second third first second third
indicative jo tu ell/ella
vostè 		nosaltres
nós 		vosaltres
vós 		ells/elles
vostès
present administro administres administra administrem administreu administren
imperfect administrava administraves administrava administràvem administràveu administraven
future administraré administraràs administrarà administrarem administrareu administraran
preterite administrí administrares administrà administràrem administràreu administraren
conditional administraria administraries administraria administraríem administraríeu administrarien
subjunctive jo tu ell/ella
vostè 		nosaltres
nós 		vosaltres
vós 		ells/elles
vostès
present administri administris administri administrem administreu administrin
imperfect administrés administressis administrés administréssim administréssiu administressin
imperative — tu vostè nosaltres vosaltres
vós 		vostès
affirmative — administra administri administrem administreu administrin
negative (no) — no administris no administri no administrem no administreu no administrin

Related terms

[edit]
  • administració
  • administrador
  • administratiu

Further reading

[edit]
  • “administrar”, in Diccionari de la llengua catalana [Dictionary of the Catalan Language] (in Catalan), second edition, Institute of Catalan Studies [Catalan: Institut d'Estudis Catalans], April 2007

Galician

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From Latin administrāre.

Verb

[edit]

administrar (first-person singular present administro, first-person singular preterite administrei, past participle administrado)

  1. (transitive) to administer (cause to take)
  2. (transitive) to administer, manage (manage or supervise the conduct of)

Conjugation

[edit]
    Conjugation of administrar
Singular Plural
First-person
(eu) 		Second-person
(ti) 		Third-person
(el / ela / Vde.) 		First-person
(nós) 		Second-person
(vós) 		Third-person
(eles / elas / Vdes.)

Related terms

[edit]
  • administración
  • administrador
  • administrativo

Further reading

[edit]
  • “administrar”, in Dicionario da Real Academia Galega (in Galician), A Coruña: Royal Galician Academy, 2012–2025

Occitan

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Learned borrowing from Latin administrāre.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • Audio (Béarn):(file)

Verb

[edit]

administrar

  1. to administer
    Synonym: bailejar

Conjugation

[edit]

Portuguese

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Learned borrowing from Latin administrāre.

Pronunciation

[edit]
 
  • (Brazil) IPA(key): /a.d͡ʒi.mi.nisˈtɾa(ʁ)/ [a.d͡ʒi.mi.nisˈtɾa(h)], /ad͡ʒ.mi.nisˈtɾa(ʁ)/ [ad͡ʒ.mi.nisˈtɾa(h)]
  • (Brazil) IPA(key): /a.d͡ʒi.mi.nisˈtɾa(ʁ)/ [a.d͡ʒi.mi.nisˈtɾa(h)], /ad͡ʒ.mi.nisˈtɾa(ʁ)/ [ad͡ʒ.mi.nisˈtɾa(h)]
    • (São Paulo) IPA(key): /a.d͡ʒi.mi.nisˈtɾa(ɾ)/, /ad͡ʒ.mi.nisˈtɾa(ɾ)/
    • (Rio de Janeiro) IPA(key): /a.d͡ʒi.mi.niʃˈtɾa(ʁ)/ [a.d͡ʒi.mi.niʃˈtɾa(χ)], /ad͡ʒ.mi.niʃˈtɾa(ʁ)/ [ad͡ʒ.mi.niʃˈtɾa(χ)]
    • (Southern Brazil) IPA(key): /ad͡ʒ.mi.nisˈtɾa(ɻ)/, /a.d͡ʒi.mi.nisˈtɾa(ɻ)/
 
  • (Portugal) IPA(key): /ɐd.mi.niʃˈtɾaɾ/ [ɐð.mi.niʃˈtɾaɾ], /ɐd.mɨ.niʃˈtɾaɾ/ [ɐð.mɨ.niʃˈtɾaɾ]
  • (Portugal) IPA(key): /ɐd.mi.niʃˈtɾaɾ/ [ɐð.mi.niʃˈtɾaɾ], /ɐd.mɨ.niʃˈtɾaɾ/ [ɐð.mɨ.niʃˈtɾaɾ]
    • (Southern Portugal) IPA(key): /ɐd.mi.niʃˈtɾa.ɾi/ [ɐð.mi.niʃˈtɾa.ɾi], /ɐd.mɨ.niʃˈtɾa.ɾi/ [ɐð.mɨ.niʃˈtɾa.ɾi]

  • Hyphenation: ad‧mi‧nis‧trar

Verb

[edit]

administrar (first-person singular present administro, first-person singular preterite administrei, past participle administrado)

  1. (transitive) to manage

Conjugation

[edit]
    Conjugation of administrar (See Appendix:Portuguese verbs)
Singular Plural
First-person
(eu) 		Second-person
(tu) 		Third-person
(ele / ela / você) 		First-person
(nós) 		Second-person
(vós) 		Third-person
(eles / elas / vocês)
Infinitive
Impersonal administrar
Personal administrar administrares administrar administrarmos administrardes administrarem
Gerund
administrando
Past participle
Masculine administrado administrados
Feminine administrada administradas
Indicative
Present administro administras administra administramos administrais administram
Imperfect administrava administravas administrava administrávamos administráveis administravam
Preterite administrei administraste administrou administramos1, administrámos2 administrastes administraram
Pluperfect administrara administraras administrara administráramos administráreis administraram
Future administrarei administrarás administrará administraremos administrareis administrarão
Conditional administraria administrarias administraria administraríamos administraríeis administrariam
Subjunctive
Present administre administres administre administremos administreis administrem
Imperfect administrasse administrasses administrasse administrássemos administrásseis administrassem
Future administrar administrares administrar administrarmos administrardes administrarem
Imperative
Affirmative administra administre administremos administrai administrem
Negative (não) não administres não administre não administremos não administreis não administrem

1Brazilian Portuguese.
2European Portuguese.

Related terms

[edit]
  • administração
  • administrador
  • administrativo

Further reading

[edit]
  • “administrar”, in Dicionário Aulete Digital (in Portuguese), Rio de Janeiro: Lexikon Editora Digital, 2008–2025
  • “administrar” in Dicionário Aberto based on Novo Diccionário da Língua Portuguesa de Cândido de Figueiredo, 1913
  • “administrar”, in Dicionário infopédia da Lingua Portuguesa (in Portuguese), Porto: Porto Editora, 2003–2025
  • “administrar”, in Michaelis Dicionário Brasileiro da Língua Portuguesa (in Portuguese), São Paulo: Editora Melhoramentos, 2015–2025
  • “administrar”, in Dicionário Priberam da Língua Portuguesa (in Portuguese), Lisbon: Priberam, 2008–2025

Spanish

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Borrowed from Latin administrāre.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /adminisˈtɾaɾ/ [að̞.mi.nisˈt̪ɾaɾ]
  • Audio (Colombia):(file)
  • Rhymes: -aɾ
  • Syllabification: ad‧mi‧nis‧trar

Verb

[edit]

administrar (first-person singular present administro, first-person singular preterite administré, past participle administrado)

  1. (transitive) to administer (cause to take)
  2. (transitive) to administer, to manage (manage or supervise the conduct of)

Conjugation

[edit]
    Conjugation of administrar (See Appendix:Spanish verbs)
infinitive administrar
gerund administrando
past participle masculine feminine
singular administrado administrada
plural administrados administradas
singular plural

indicative yo tú

usted 		nosotros
nosotras 		vosotros
vosotras 		ellos/ellas
ustedes

administrásvos 		administra administramos administráis administran

preterite administré administraste administró administramos administrasteis administraron
future administraré administrarás administrará administraremos administraréis administrarán
conditional administraría administrarías administraría administraríamos administraríais administrarían

vos 		él/ella/ello
usted 		nosotros

vosotras 		ellos/ellas
ustedes

administrésvos2 		administre administremos administréis administren

vos 		usted nosotros
nosotras 		vosotros

affirmative administratú
administrávos 		administre administremos administrad administren
negative no administres no administre no administremos no administréis no administren

1Mostly obsolete, now mainly used in legal language.
2Argentine and Uruguayan voseo prefers the tú form for the present subjunctive.

    Selected combined forms of administrar

These forms are generated automatically and may not actually be used. Pronoun usage varies by region.
